text: This is a fascinating story told by Alan Kay on how a Smalltalk system allows for dynamic requirement changes to be added on the fly <https://www.quora.com/How-do-I-lay-out-my-software-architecture-before-I-code-if-the-requirements-change-every-day/answer/Alan-Kay-11>. His final comment on a much better CAD-SIM (design-simulation) system is exciting.

attachments.title: Alan Kay's answer to How do I lay out my software architecture before I code if the requirements change every day? - Quora
attachments.text: Here’s an exemplary process from the past that is a good start on how to think about the present, and even more importantly about the future. A change in federal laws in the mid-80s rendered much of public utility Brooklyn Union Gas’s database an...
attachments.fallback: Alan Kay's answer to How do I lay out my software architecture before I code if the requirements change every day? - Quora

. His final comment on a much better CAD-SIM (design-simulation) system is exciting.

text:
Careful romanticizing the past too much :slightly_smiling_face:

<https://twitter.com/imranchaudhri/status/1374934903188414467>

In the thread: "We’ve set up 90s OS virtual machines for all the OG programs and their wizards plus HyperCard just so I can show James it isn’t as glamorous as he remembers it in our product dives"

attachments.fallback:
<https://twitter.com/imranchaudhri|@imranchaudhri>: in 1995, while interning at apple, i bought a NeXT cube for $150 at stanford surplus

while designing mac os X with steve, he liked to tell us how the NeXT was better

so i started bringing in my cube to win arguments by showing him that things weren't as good as he remembered
attachments.text:

elements.text: Careful romanticizing the past too much
In the thread: "We’ve set up 90s OS virtual machines for all the OG programs and their wizards plus HyperCard just so I can show James it isn’t as glamorous as he remembers it in our product dives"

text: Things don't get strictly worse or strictly better, rather they do both at the same time in different ways.
